publication.title: caCORE: A common infrastructure for cancer informatics
publication.authors: peter a. covitz,frank w. hartel,sherri de coronado,gilberto fragoso,himanso sahni,scott gustafson,kenneth h. buetow
publication.keyword: Application Program Interface;Biomedical Application;Controlled Vocabulary;Data Integrity;Data Processing;Data Representation;Object-oriented Model;Open Source;Scientific Application;Web Interface;National Cancer Institute;Simple Object Access Protocol;
publication.abstract: Motivation: Sites with substantive bioinformatics operations are challenged to build data processing and delivery infrastruc- ture that provides reliable access and enables data integration. Locally generated data must be processed and stored such that relationships to external data sources can be presen- ted. Consistency and comparability across data sets requires annotation with controlled vocabularies and, further, metadata standards for data

publication.title: PID: the Pathway Interaction Database
publication.authors: kira anthony,shiva krupa,jeffrey buchoff,timo hannay,kenneth h. buetow
publication.keyword: Cell Signaling;Extensible Markup Language;Interaction Network;Peer Review;Signal Transduction;Single Molecule;level 2;National Cancer Institute;
publication.abstract: The Pathway Interaction Database (PID, http://pid. nci.nih.gov) is a freely available collection of curated and peer-reviewed pathways composed of human molecular signaling and regulatory events and key cellular processes. Created in a collaboration between the US National Cancer Institute and Nature Publishing Group, the database serves as a research tool for the cancer research community and others interested in cellular
